intro: Bouchea chascanoides, commonly known as the Chascanos flower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces vibrant yellow to orange blooms. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Bouchea chascanoides is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
